publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich*, David Mundell*, Alex Fergusson*
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Phil Gallie*

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton
S1M-562 Volvo Factory, Irvine (lodged on 17 February 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-562 Michael Russell: Volvo Factory, Irvine—That the Parliament supports the workforce of the Volvo factory in Irvine at this present time of uncertainty and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make every possible representation to ensure the plant’s future. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Kay Ullrich, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Lloyd Quinan
